alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 6:03PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL, SOUTH CENTRAL HARDING AND CENTRAL QUAY COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM MDT... At 602 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northwest of Tucumcari, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Logan and Ute Lake State Park. This includes State Road 104 between Mile Markers 93 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern and east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County; Quay County
